intro: Ageratina henzium, commonly known as the whiteflower blueweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Ageratina henzium is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
